title: How to Stimulate Your Brain and Straighten Your Spinal Chord: Tips for Mental and Physical Well-being in Daily Life?
first_phrase: In the previous section, the author discusses the importance of balanced eating habits and avoiding overeating to maintain mental clarity. They then introduce a form of exercise called "rapidly stimulating exercises" to combat mental torpor. In the last 200 tokens, the author describes a specific posture and breathing exercise that can quickly energize the body and emphasizes the importance of a straightened spinal cord for developing willpower. The next chapter will provide further advice on physical well-being for eurhythmy.
content: When you have reached a high point by stretching yourselves upwardly, you must hold your breath for 3 seconds. You should thereafter move down, exhaling air and relaxing your fists as you do so. Having reached the lowest possible point, you can then relax for 3 seconds. Breathing timing of the exercise Straightening the spinal chord The spinal chord is essential to the development of the will. A slightly modified variant of the previous exercise of lifting oneself on the heels might additionally be carried out for the purpose of straightening the spinal chord. Starting from a posture of “military salute”, you slowly lift up the heels of your joined feet, while the spinal chord is stiffened as much as possible (contrary to the preceding exercise, where it was in fact relaxed). The exercise is rendered even more effective by bringing one’s crossed hands behind the nape of the back as it is carried out. last_phrase: In conclusion, to enhance your physical and mental wellbeing, following the breathing timing and spinal chord exercises can be a great start towards achieving self-mastery. Additionally, practicing control over your thoughts, focusing on original thinking, determining efficient routes, and letting go of physical tensions pave the way towards a more fulfilling life.
